The Rev. Cardinal Malcum is head of Catholic church in Sir lanka. You can not compare him with some monks but a Mahanayake of Asgiriya or Malwatta Captor. Some monks are aggressive and some are dramatically calm.  His handling of the situation is without a question commendable. His refusal of the bullet proof vehicle is his personal choice but it does not rationalize in the context of security. What if he is a victim of terrorism without a adequate protection. He should be protected and guarded as there is one Cardinal in Sri lanka. The state is duty bound to protect head of religious institute. Do not mix up with emotional opinion vs security. you Sound more like a Cristian.

I am a Christian, educated and grown up in Buddhist environment . Not all Buddhist Monks are the same. There are very reverent and respectful Monks who live a very simple life as Cardinal Ranith . I worked in Rural Sri Lanka as a teacher and there was a young monk with Master degree from the University of Kalaniya who walk every school day 06 km one way to the school through a very difficult and hilly walkway. One day we visited his temple, and I could not believe how poor looking it is..... They live a very silence life and practice the endurance to the fullest level in their lives so the outside world know very little about them, Example: Deulagala Maha Nayake Thero.
